member.name: F:SocketProAdapter.UDB.tagRollbackPlan.rpDefault
member.summary: Manual transaction will rollback whenever there is an error by default

member.name: F:SocketProAdapter.UDB.tagRollbackPlan.rpRollbackErrorAny
member.summary: Manual transaction will rollback whenever there is an error by default

member.name: F:SocketProAdapter.UDB.tagRollbackPlan.rpRollbackErrorLess
member.summary: Manual transaction will rollback as long as the number of errors is less than the number of ok processing statements

member.name: F:SocketProAdapter.UDB.tagRollbackPlan.rpRollbackErrorEqual
member.summary: Manual transaction will rollback as long as the number of errors is less or equal than the number of ok processing statements

member.name: F:SocketProAdapter.UDB.tagRollbackPlan.rpRollbackErrorMore
member.summary: Manual transaction will rollback as long as the number of errors is more than the number of ok processing statements

member.name: F:SocketProAdapter.UDB.tagRollbackPlan.rpRollbackErrorAll
member.summary: Manual transaction will rollback only if all the processing statements are failed

member.name: F:SocketProAdapter.UDB.tagRollbackPlan.rpRollbackAlways
member.summary: Manual transaction will rollback always no matter what happens.

member.name: P:SocketProAdapter.IMessageQueueBasic.Optimistic
member.summary: A value for how to flush message writing into hard disk. It defaults to the value oSystemMemoryCached. If the property is set to oSystemMemorycached or oDiskCommitted, queue file stream is immediately flushed into system memory or hard disk, respectively. Otherwise, queue file stream may be flushed with delay. Queue file stream will be flushed into system memory or hard disk whenever setting the property to oSystemMemorycached or oDiskCommitted.

member.name: P:SocketProAdapter.ClientSide.IClientQueue.RoutingQueueIndex
member.summary: A bool value for enabling or disabling routing queue index. The property defaults to false. If there is only one worker application instance running (Note that one instance may have multiple socket connections), it ensures once-only delivery if this property is set to true. If there are multiple worker application instances running, you should not set this property to true! Otherwise, SocketPro may function incorrectly in dequeuing messages.
